list.title: ApiUtil.executeApiDeleteRequest
list.description: Executes single DELETE request and fires callback.

list.title: ApiUtil.executeApiGetRequest
list.description: Executes single GET request and fires callback once for each returned page.

list.title: ApiUtil.executeApiPatchRequest
list.description: Executes single PATCH request and fires callback.

list.title: ApiUtil.executeApiPostRequest
list.description: Executes single CREATE request and fires callback.

list.title: ApiUtil.replaceInputValues
list.description: Takes in a string with placeholders like ${variable} and replaces them with values found in selected sheet's top part.

list.title: SheetUtil.appendOutputToRange
list.description: Writes the given two-dimensional Array of data to the specified sheet, appending the data to any already existing data in the

list.title: SheetUtil.clearData
list.description: Clears all entity data in the specified sheet.

list.title: SheetUtil.deleteSheetRows
list.description: Removes row from the sheet by sheet name and number

list.title: SheetUtil.getCurrentlySelectedDataRowNumber
list.description: Returns currently selected row (number) for chosen sheet. Throws error if currently selected row isn't in data part of the sheet, or if

list.title: SheetUtil.getHeaderRowData
list.description: Returns values in header row of selected sheet as a 1-dim Array.

list.title: SheetUtil.getInputCellValues
list.description: Retrieves value of input cell configured in configuration.js

list.title: SheetUtil.getRowData
list.description: Returns the row data for the given sheet and range as a two-dimensional Array of length 1.

list.title: SheetUtil.readDataRows
list.description: Reads all rows of a sheet designated by sheetConfig and returns cell values as {!Array<!RowData>}

list.title: Util.extend
list.description: Extends an object identified by 'original' with the values in 'extension'. 'extension' will be returned if 'original' is null, otherwise 'original' will get extended. Array values in 'extension' will be appended to existing arrays in 'original', however all other objects in 'extension' will override existing counterparts in 'original'. The plain JS type of 'original' will be preserved (if it wasn't null or undefined - i.e. passing an instance of a specific class will not be overrided, rather extended).

list.title: Util.flattenObject
list.description: Traverses object's sub-structure and converts it from {a:{b:{c:"value"}}} to {"a.b.c":"value"}

list.title: Util.getValueByDottedFieldName
list.description: Retrieves value from nested sub-objects by dot-separated path (aka 'dotted field name')

list.title: Util.listDottedFields
list.description: Unnests field names in an object, producing array of 'field.nestedfield.subnestedfield'

list.title: Util.modifyUrlQueryString
list.description: Modifies a url by either appending the 'key' and 'value' to the end of the url if the 'key' was not present or replacing the value of the 'key' if it existed. Multiple values for the same key will all be replaced by a single key-value pair at the first seen key location. Assumes that all params have already been URL encoded.

list.title: assembleTable
list.description: The assembleTable function takes in a 2D array of data and returns an HTML string representing a table with the data.

list.title: assembleTypesList
list.description: Assembles the list of types with their names.

list.title: assembleTypesListForSheet
list.description: Assembles the list of types with their names into a 2-dimensional array for use in a Google Sheet.

list.title: buildRequest
list.description: This function builds and sends multiple requests to retrieve market history data for specific item types in a specific region using the GESI library in JavaScript.

list.title: cacheUrlFetchApp
list.description: Checks if the return from a Url fetch is in cache. If so, it retrieves it from cache instead of making another network request. If not, it makes a new request and adds it to the cache

list.title: cardinalToOrdinal
list.description: The function converts a cardinal number to its corresponding ordinal form.

list.title: contractAppraisal
list.description: The function contractAppraisal takes in several parameters and constructs a URL for an API request to the Contracts Appraisal service.

list.title: createTree
list.description:
createTree method for FilesApp.

  • Create a file and folder tree. Retrieve all folders of all level under folderId. All files and folders are included in an array with the level.

list.title: cropCols
list.description: Deletes any blank columns in a given sheet, leaving a minimum number of columns.

list.title: cropRows
list.description: Deletes any blank rows in a given sheet, leaving a minimum number of rows.

list.title: cropSheet
list.description: Crops a given sheet by deleting any blank rows or columns, leaving a minimum number of rows and columns.

list.title: daysSince
list.description: The function calculates the number of days between a given date and the current date.

list.title: driveWrite
list.description: Saves the given object in the user's drive with the given title and mimeType. It then logs the file name, ID, size (in bytes), and type of the newly created file.

list.title: ensure2dArray
list.description: This function takes an input data and checks if it is a two-dimensional array. If the input data is not an array, it wraps it in a single-element array. If the input data is already a two-dimensional array, it returns the data as-is.

list.title: fetchAllianceKills
list.description: This function fetches all kills for a given alliance ID from the zKillboard API.

list.title: fetchAllianceLosses
list.description: This function fetches all losses for a given alliance ID from the zKillboard API.

list.title: fetchCorporationKills
list.description: Fetches corporation kills from the zKillboard API.

list.title: fetchCorporationLosses
list.description: Fetches the losses for a specific corporation from the zKillboard API.

list.title: getAllFoldersInFolder
list.description:
getAllFoldersInFolder method for FilesApp.

  • Retrieve all folders of all level under folderId.

list.title: getAllInFolder
list.description:
getAllInFolder method for FilesApp.

  • Retrieve all files and folders of all level under folderId. All files and folders are included in an array without the level.

list.title: getDateTimeCol
list.description: This function retrieves the column index of a timestamp header in a Google Sheets spreadsheet.

list.title: getEveMarketerData_
list.description: This function retrieves market data for a list of item IDs from the EveMarketer API.

list.title: getFilesAndFoldersInFolder
list.description:
GitHub https://github.com/tanaikech/FilesApp
getFilesAndFoldersInFolder method for FilesApp.

  • Retrieve files and folders just under a folder with folderId.

list.title: getFolderByName
list.description: Returns a Google Drive folder in the same location in Drive where the spreadsheet is located. First, it checks if the folder already exists and returns that folder. If the folder doesn't already exist, the script creates a new one. The folder's name is set by the "OUTPUT_FOLDER_NAME" variable from the Code.gs file.

list.title: getFolderContents
list.description: Return an array of up to 20 filenames contained in the folder previously specified (or the root folder by default).

list.title: getIndustryPrices
list.description: The function retrieves industry prices for items in the game EVE Online and returns them in a sorted array, with the option to include headers.

list.title: getTypeIds
list.description: Retrieves the type IDs from the ESI API.

list.title: loadRegionAggregates~fetchAggregatesData
list.description: Fetches aggregates data from the API for the specified batches and region ID.

list.title: loadRegionAggregates~getCleanTypeIds
list.description: Returns an array of clean type IDs by removing duplicates and filtering out non-numeric values.

list.title: loadRegionAggregates~processResponses
list.description: Processes the fetched responses and extracts the required data.

list.title: loadRegionAggregates~splitIntoBatches
list.description: Splits the array of type IDs into batches based on the defined batch size.

list.title: onEdit
list.description: This function automatically adds a timestamp to a specific column in a Google Sheets document when a cell in another column is edited.

list.title: prepareSheet
list.description: The function prepares a sheet in a Google Spreadsheet by either clearing its contents or creating a new sheet if it doesn't exist.

list.title: propService.docProps.read()
list.description: Reads properties with the given keys the given object to script properties and writes them to the object parameter.

list.title: propService.scriptProps.read()
list.description: Reads properties with the given keys the given object to script properties and writes them to the object parameter.

list.title: propService.scriptProps.write()
list.description: Writes the given object's key/value pairs to script properties

list.title: propService.scriptProps.write()
list.description: Writes the given object's key/value pairs to script properties

list.title: propService.userProps.read()
list.description: Reads properties with the given keys the given object to user properties and writes them to the object parameter.

list.title: propService.userProps.write()
list.description: Writes the given object's key/value pairs to user properties

list.title: readDrive
list.description: Accesses a file of the users's drive with the given fileID

list.title: resolveIdsToNames
list.description: Resolves the given type IDs to their corresponding names.

list.title: sheets.js
list.description: This Google Apps Script file contains general utility methods used by the different modules in this application.

list.title: timestamp
list.description: Assembles and returns a timestamp string in the format of "yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ", where "yyyy" is the year, "MM" is the month, "dd" is the day, "hh" is the hour, "mm" is the minute, "ss" is the second, and "Z" indicates that the timestamp is in UTC time.
